name: Fairmont Chateau Laurier

reviews.text: I was in Ottawa for work and decided to see the "best" and book a stay at the Fairmont Chateau Laurier. Unfortunately, I was very disappointed with the customer service. Very rude front desk personnel and unwilling to help. Travelling from out of town, I had needed to check in an hour early so that I had sufficient time to shower and change into my suit for an interview. Repeatedly told I wasn't able to and offered no alternative.
reviews.title: Awful customer service

reviews.text: I recommend if you are coming to town to stay somewhere more accommodating. It's a lovely hotel but annoying problems like this really spoil the experience.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.text: I would highly recommend this hotel for its amazing location, its history and its beauty.
reviews.title: Very nice but needs some TLC

reviews.text: This hotel is over 100 years old and is rich in history. The lobby is very impressive as are the staff who I found to be very friendly and helpful. The turndown service and complimentary bottled water are well appreciated.
reviews.title: Expensive for the quality, room service awful

reviews.text: I only ate breakfast in the hotel as there are many excellent restuarants within easy walking distance. But the breakfast was excellent with a choice of buffet or a la carte, and was not overly expensive for the class of hotel.
reviews.title: The Class of Ottawa
Stunning hotel
reviews.text: Beautiful grand hotel from the art deco era or before - lots of original grandeur left - great photographs on main showing celebrities and royalty staying there - the hightlight was the very large swimming pool - art deco style with beautiful balcony surrounding it and also one of the better gyms in a hotel i've seen - everything here was wonderful, a don't miss .

reviews.title: Regaining former glory
reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel 5 years ago and it was showing its age - chunky furniture (which I know we think of as "periodic") but cold and clunky.

reviews.title: A grand old hotel in the heart of the city, but service was lacking
reviews.text: Renovations have been going on and this grand old lady is largely up to date. New flat panel TVs, classical but updated decor, great bathrooms - only hotel where I can get a full length bath in a standard room and have a decent soak.

reviews.title: This is the hotel in Ottawa -- just needs a few minor adjustments
reviews.text: For tourists this is an unbeatable position next to the parliament. Has a well maintained but updated classic hotel feel. Food is on the expensive side but updated and contemporary and illustrates the best of local cuisine.

reviews.title: Definitely worth it!
reviews.text: A very good choice for the classic Canadian railway hotels brought up to a modern standard.

The Fairmont Chateau Laurier has a gorgeous lobby. Lots of character, elegant to the nines and classy like it's going out of style. Too bad the room I had didn't evoke these same qualities. My room was terribly small, but on the plus side it was comfortable enough and it certainly had charm.
reviews.title: It's Simply Grand and Charming......the Lobby

reviews.text: From reading previous reviews, you may want to take their advice and upgrade to a deluxe room if it fits your budget.
reviews.title: Amazing building with service to match

reviews.text: Service was exceptional and courteous.
reviews.title: A grand old pile...
Inspiring View in Snow-Coated City
reviews.text: I stayed at The Chateau Laurier from Dec. 28-30, along with hundreds of young children in town for a international hockey tournament at the same time. The staff of the hotel was very accomidating in realizing that I was not traveling with children and placed all the hockey teams on seperate floors from the adult only rooms. The added expense for a deluxe room is well worth it in this hotel and if possible ask if room 500 is available. This is a large corner room with a writing area placed in the corner turret of the hotel. The views are of both Parliament and the lake behind the hotel ( amazing in winter with the snow and christmas lighting!) The staff matched up to the hotel - the concierge helped with the usual dinner recommendations & reservations, but also helped with getting to a Senators game and even took care of sending several packaes for me by FedEx. The room service was quick and very good - I tried both a meal and late night deserts. This definately is not anything like a chain hotel such as the adjacent Westin, but a true vacation experience away from the ordinary.

reviews.title: Not for everybody, but I love it...
reviews.text: Ottawa's Fairmont inhabits one of the grandest and most ancient hotel buildings in North America, and its site at the pivotal point in Official Ottawa affords great views of and close proximity to the old architectural heart of the city. All this alone will make you feel special if you stay there. But this is not a 5-star luxury hotel -- it's a bit more like a very nice Marriott that happens to be living inside a piece of architectural history. And there are some precautions you should take as you make reservations and check into this hotel. While rooms are quiet and corridors are very spacious, there seem to be several levels of renovations that have been done to the rooms. Some are oddly shaped, dowdy and smell like an elderly aunt's house, while others are pristine, cushy, and elegant -- and the front desk doesn't seem to know which rooms are which. To be safe, you should reserve a deluxe room, insisting on one that has been recently renovated, and then ask to be relocated if the room they give you isn't satisfactory. There are lovely rooms in this hotel, but there is a wide array of room conditions. That makes it inadvisable to stay at this hotel if it's almost fully booked, because the selection at check-in will be limited, and you might be stuck in an "aunt's room". One further piece of advice for business travelers: Don't expect to rely on a computer in the business center after 6 p.m. (when it closes), because after-hours access is restricted to one computer in a cramped, overheated side room.

This historic, grand hotel is a landmark in Ottawa. Location is very central - and if you are out walking around, it's super easy to find your way back to the hotel, because of the prominence of this building on the skyline of Ottawa. It's right next to the canal and the Parliment Buildings.
reviews.title: Elegant Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was very good (hotel staff was very cheery) and rooms were spacious and well maintained. For what you get, the price is very reasonable.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: I spent a week-end there last year with my girlfriend and we had a good time. The hotel is quite luxurious and the staff is great. We asked the concierge for good restaurants and bars in the area, and he was super nice. Nice views and amazing location. Even if Ottawa isn't my favorite city (I actually find it kind of boring), I enjoyed my stay and the atmosphere at the hotel. The spa is nice, the pool is weird... in the basement, no windows and not that much space to sit around.
reviews.title: If you love history and elegance stay here

reviews.text: I also went there on my own for work and I ordered room service. It is way too expensive for what you get and it's not even that good. I don't mind paying for good food, but I find 35$ for a spaguetti with tomato sauce (almost no sauce) + a sprite is a bit crazy. I tried a couple of restaurants near the hotel, and I really enjoyed Zack's for a quick lunch (old dinner style). Good steak and ambiance at Empire Grill.
reviews.title: Wonderful service, charming hotel

reviews.text: Even if it's a bit expensive, you can get a good deal if you reserve a room in advance. I would recommend this place if you have to stay in Ottawa.
reviews.title: If someone else is paying, go for it!
Great location - That's mostly it.
reviews.text: Location: The hotel is in the heart of downtown Ottawa, right next to the Parliament buildings, the Byward Market, the Rideau Centre and Canel and close enough by car, taxi or bus to many museums.

reviews.title: One of the best hotels I've been to
reviews.text: Check in/out: No issues. Very quick.

reviews.title: Excellent stay
reviews.text: Parking: If coming by car, you need to find a spot in front of the hotel turning circle while a member of your party runs in to check in and get a parking pass. Note that there is not a lot of room to let your car stand while doing so, but everyone seems to manage. Parking is $25 plus tax a day to self park with unlimited entry and exit during your stay. Valet is also available. Entrance is to the left of the front of the hotel off Rideau street. There is 5 levels which seems to be ample parking. Fairly easy access right into the hotel ground floor.

reviews.title: Chateau Laurier- - "Fairmont Gold..." ahhhh....WE LOVED IT!
reviews.text: Rooms: This hotel was built in 1908-12 and it has a grand exterior, but the rooms are small and showing their age. The hotel really packs the rooms in.

reviews.title: Liked a lot!
reviews.text: The biggest issue noted was that the walls are quite thin so if you have an inconsiderate guest next door or near by you will hear it. (Call for front desk/security and hope for the best).

reviews.title: Thank goodness for the Chateau Laurier!
reviews.text: My husband and I went to Ottawa for the weekend early in March. We arrived at another hotel (Novotel), and everything in our Junior Suite was not quite right (an open bottle of water, no wastebasket in the bathroom, a bathrobe that had clearly been washed in hot water and would now fit a small child, water damage on the walls . . . ). When my husband and I called to let them know that we needed a bathrobe that fit, a wastepaper basket in the bathroom, and (I forgot to mention this above) that a roll of toilet paper might be a nice amenity, they promptly ignored us. My husband was less than thrilled, and asked me to call the Chateau. What a difference!

reviews.title: Great Stay!
reviews.text: I called the Chateau to make a reservation. The agent was warm, friendly, and asked about specific likes, dislikes in a room. The rate was higher than at the Novotel, but we got a large room, with a sitting area, and a view of the Parliament. At check-in, my husband asked if we could have a room with a view; the receptionist said we would have a room with a view, since this was among our preferences. The room itself was large (though not quite a Junior Suite), and very comfortable. The furniture was traditional without being pretentious, the bed was incredibly comfortable, and housekeeping was accomodating (we slept in). Everything was clean and comfortable, including the bathroom, which was sparkling.

reviews.title: Decor is elegant and fabulous, but didn't get what I asked for
reviews.text: Because the Chateau is one of those old hotels with lots of history in every nook and cranny, we spent time exploring the place, which is filled with old photgraphs and interesting artwork. The Art Deco pool in the basement was beautiful.

reviews.title: Elegant, Gorgeous Hotel
reviews.text: On Saturday afternoon, my husband and I went for afternoon tea. I had the traditional tea service (the Jasmine tea is divine!) and my husband had the more substantial Canadian tea service, which is more like an English high tea, with cheese and meats served. We were both thrilled with the food, the service, and the view of the city from the tea room.

reviews.title: Excellent Location but....
reviews.text: The Chateau has an excellent location. The employees know the city, and are happy to help you in a million big and small ways. The hotel itself is charming, and, in our opinion, worth the price. We will return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Chateau annually for 4 years and will continue to do so. The location is fabulous, the staff wonderful and they love our little dog. There is nothing we can say but wonderful things. My husband would actually like to live in the hotel like Karsh did. It makes our stay in Ottawa very special.
reviews.title: Excellent Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service- For the price you pay for the room, the service SHOULD be impeccable. However, I feel like it was the same standard of service you would receive at a 3 star hotel.
reviews.title: Too pricey for what you get.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Value- For the price I paid, I expected a little more than what I received. The room was nice, however at $300+ per night it was not worth it. Especially since you can get an all inclusive vacation in the Carribean for the price of 4 nights at this hotel.
reviews.title: New Years Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sleep Quality- Bed was comfortable.
reviews.title: The Perfect Ottawa Hotel

reviews.text: Cleanliness- Very clean.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in a good location

reviews.text: We stayed at the Laurier for 2 nights on Marathon weekend. The hotel was completely sold out, yet we were still upgraded to a huge, newly-renovated room. Comfortable beds, peaceful hallways, fantastic breakfast buffet, helpful staff. Definitely worth the $$
reviews.title: Wonderful Fairmont
What a place!
reviews.text: Wow! I felt like a princess. We stayed 2 days, one night and ate all of our meals there. Each meal impressed me more than the last. The service and the food were of qualities I've never experienced. The staff were charming, and helpful. The food was delicious and fairly priced. We ate at both Wilfred's and Zoe's.
The hotel was a beautiful place full of antiques, flowers and brass. The pool was spectacular, equipped with heatlamps poolside and large private change areas.
reviews.title: Lots attmosphere
Lovely grand hotel right in the heart of the city
reviews.text: I can't wait to go back and feel like royalty again.

We just returned from a 2 night stay and it was wonderful. The hotel was part of a tour and I thought this might affect the locations of the rooms, but they were all on one floor and in good location. They had lots of staff who were very curteous and timely as to our varied needs. You can't beat the location if you only have a couple of days. The hotel will help you with transporation and suggestions. Do the Parliment tower for views and use the canal boat for a very relaxing and informative hour cruise. Lots to do and I wish we had more time. Remember to check prices at the bar and restaraunt as they are quite expensive but have lots of atmosphere. Highly recommend this city and hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful classic Hotel

reviews.text: Located across from Parliament, we stay for 4 nights at Chaeau Laurier while covering the NHL All Star Game in January 2012. The staff was as helpful as any, the resources exceeded expectations and was the perfect setting to get around the smaller downtown area. The room was average size for a queen room but we had a great view of Parliament and was cleaned according to our varying schedule.
reviews.title: Wonderful Ottawa experience

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel several times while on business trips but this review concerns my last stay in February 2012.
reviews.title: In desperate need of renovation and better service

reviews.text: While my previous experience was good, this stay is probably one of the worst on my list. The hotel is still the remarkable and convenient building from outside but a deteriorated one in terms of service, cleanliness and facilities from inside.
reviews.title: In need of renovations

reviews.text: My room was the upgraded to a “nice view” one. It was fairly large and nice from first sight. Then the reality struck - a bathroom probably dating back to the first renovation (whenever this was), stained filthy carpet, toiletry items from different brands, cracks on the walls, an ancient hairdryer (not functioning) and a museum ready “dream machine” – radio clock. I have to admit that the worst was the bathroom – baring all the signs of age and the associated dirt. If you are into a modern clean (even worse – zen) type of bathroom experience – don’t even put your foot inside.
reviews.title: A very disappointing experience; will not go back again!

reviews.text: Service – zero. When I was checking out the printers didn’t work, so no invoice was delivered during the night and then they made me wait for one in the lobby without even apologizing (just saying “You need to wait 15 mins”) for 40 minutes! I wasn’t even offered the option of receiving the invoice by e-mail. I guess it was my fault that I didn’t think about this.
reviews.title: Impromptu Stay

reviews.text: We travel to Ottawa several times a year and always stay at the Albert at Bay - but just out of curiosity (and the fact that the city was sold out for race weekend which is Memorial Day weekend in the US) we gave the chateau a try.
reviews.title: Look at it, go inside, but stay elsewhere

reviews.text: True, it's lovely from the outside. Also, the location is just fantastic as you can walk to everything you'll need.
reviews.title: Canada Day in Ottawa was Great

reviews.text: However, for the money, it's just not that "special."
reviews.title: Almost but not quite

reviews.text: I was especially disappointed with the pool and changing facilities. I have a toddler so it would have been great if the pool were child-friendly. Alas, it wasn't worth the work of finding and navigating the changing rooms just to get to the pool to find it has no stairs and isn't heated!
reviews.title: Like stayiing in a castle
Magical place to start your married life together
reviews.text: We'll be back....at the Albert-at-Bay.

Perhaps when you think that you are going to be staying in a "castle" your expectations get way up there. This hotel, a main Ottawa landmark itself, looks amazing in the outside, its lobby is OK, its restaurants are excellent, but once you go up in the elevators, another is another story, once you get to the very wide and empty hallways, with old carpet and awful color walls. Although everything is in good condition, a "this feels like an old place" feeling and haunted-castle creepy thoughts almost come to your mind. The rooms are quite good, but I don´t think are what you would get for what you are paying. The advantage of great location also means that you get a lot of street noise if you get a front-view room as I did. The castle glamour then is forgotten once all you want to do is to relax and sleep.
reviews.title: An Ottawa landmark, an old hotel inside

likes.disliked: — Internet connection, color of the walls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff is super friendly and professional, although the cleaning ladies might be a little pushy to clean the room when you are still inside. The gym, is not a gym, is just a couple of machines, mostly cardio, although the pool looks nice (not as nice as in the Web site).
reviews.title: Beauty from afar

likes.disliked: — incredibly worn out rooms in need of renovation and updating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recommend the management of the hotel to paint the walls and get a carpet in the same pattern as they have in their restaurant, obviously is not a matter of bad taste, it is only about updating and spending some money.
reviews.title: A timeless classic

likes.liked: — Luxurious surroundings with a touch of class
likes.disliked: — If you own a larger SUV beware of the low ceiling in the carpark

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Internet connection I found it to be quite expensive, and it is not wireless - again - this hotel needs to catch up!
reviews.title: Castle with Service fit for Royalty
Conveniently Located Castle
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night over the Canada Day Weekend. Awesome location for tourists and great views of Parliament Hill. The hotel itself is a tourist attraction – a lovely historic building and beautiful lobby and other public spaces – but you don’t normally choose to sleep in a museum do you?
Beautiful Hotel--but needs some attention:
reviews.title: Beautiful well located hotel--needs some attention

likes.disliked: — Very dated--old small television and poor air conditioning. No weekend business services.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the common areas of the hotel but found the rooms to be dated--no blackout curtains, small not very well lit bathroom and an air conditioner that could never cool to desired temperature. The television was small and very old.
reviews.title: THE Signature Ottawa Hotel

likes.liked: — The charm of yesteryear is still intact.
likes.disliked: — Softgoods could do with an update.

reviews.text: I found the food to be excellent but pricey. Service was very slow in Zoe's--had to search out the waiter three times.
reviews.title: Dated

likes.disliked: — Low standards for a hotel of this category.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the front desk and housekeeping staff to be very cordial, prompt and efficient.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, had a perfect stay

reviews.text: I was with an international business group and was not very happy to find out that the business center did not have weekend hours--I travel internationally and have never encountered this

description: Reflecting the confidence, dignity and style of Ottawa, Fairmont Chateau Laurier stands as a testament to this dynamic, thriving city. Located in the heart of Canada's capital next door to the Parliament Buildings, the landmark Fairmont Chateau Laurier hotel in Ottawa is a magnificent limestone edifice with turrets and masonry reminiscent of a French chateau.
